text:
For the First Time, Every NYFW Runway Had a Model of Color 
Plus, Marc Jacobs had one of the most racially diverse shows. Most Popular By Kristina Rodulfo Feb 23, 2017 In TheFashionSpot 's latest New York Fashion Week diversity report surveying 116 shows and 2,700 model castings, the biggest takeaway is that every single Fall 2017 runway featured at least one model of color. It's a shame that this is newsworthy in 2017 but at least there's evidence the industry is inching closer to change. Overall, 68.5% of castings were white and 31.5% were nonwhite. On top of racial diversity, this season had the most body diversity with 26 plus-size model appearances on nine different runways. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below The work isn't done yet, of course. Sara Ziff of The Model Alliance said it best in a statement, "We're still seeing tokenism and we're not yet seeing widespread acceptance of models across categories—models of various sizes, ages, races and gender identities." She continued, "In this day and age–between the media coverage calling out the industry's blind spots, and the calls for health and diversity from industry groups, especially at this moment in our country politically–we'd hoped to see more widespread, dramatic change."
